results.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Sheryl Gay Stolberg
results.title: Under Pressure, Biden Issues Executive Order on Abortion
results.abstract: After the Supreme Court’s ruling, some of the president’s supporters have wanted him to push harder to protect abortion access. But details about what his new order will do remain unclear.

results.title: The U.S. May Be Losing the Fight Against Monkeypox, Scientists Say
results.abstract: Longstanding weaknesses in the public health system are giving the virus a chance to become entrenched.

media.caption: B, a medical writer in San Francisco, suspected monkeypox after a blister appeared on his wrist following a sexual encounter. It took nearly two weeks to confirm the case.

results.title: Man Who Swung Bat at Squeegee Workers in Baltimore Is Fatally Shot
results.abstract: The man, who had a heated confrontation with the workers as he drove through a downtown intersection, parked his car, approached the group with a baseball bat and swung it at them, the police said.

results.title: I Don’t Want to See a High School Football Coach Praying at the 50-Yard Line
results.abstract: It offends me to see sanctimonious public prayer in any circumstance; still, how do people who believe entirely in science and reason also believe that prayer can heal and restore?

results.title: What’s Up With the Crazy Housing Market?
results.abstract: Rising mortgage rates. Faltering home sales. Skyrocketing rents. Here’s how to make sense of a baffling real estate market.

media.caption: Igor Popov, the chief economist for Apartment List, thinks the rental market will remain competitive. “Whether a restaurant has a waitlist of 10 people or 30 people, you’re still not getting in for dinner,” he said.

results.title: Why Are We Still Talking About Black Mountain College?

results.title: 911 Dispatcher Faces Manslaughter Charge After Failing to Send Ambulance
results.abstract: The authorities in Pennsylvania said the dispatcher told a woman that he would not send an ambulance to her mother unless the mother agreed to go to the hospital. She died the next day.

media.caption: Kelly D. Titchenell told the 911 dispatcher that her mother, Diania Kronk, needed to go to the hospital or “she’s going to die.”

results.byline: By Jay Senter and Shaila Dewan
results.title: Killer of George Floyd Sentenced to 21 Years for Violating Civil Rights
results.abstract: Derek Chauvin, already serving more than 22 years in state prison for murder, pleaded guilty to federal charges that he used excessive force against Mr. Floyd and a 14-year-old boy.

media.caption: Derek Chauvin during sentencing in his state trial in June 2021. He will serve his state and federal sentences concurrently.

results.title: It’s Time to Stop Living the American Scam
results.abstract: We’ve been “productive” enough — produced way too much, in fact. And there is too much that urgently needs to be done.
